snippet: A group of Israelis was arrested in what one official described as a revenge killing. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu pledged to pursue the case and said, “We do not differentiate between terrorists.”
abstract: Israeli authorities arrest six Israelis in what one official describes as revenge killing of 16-year-old Palestinian Muhammad Abu Khdeir, who was found beaten and burned; Israel's Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu condemns what he calls horrific crime and says anyone found guilty will face full prosecution.

byline.contributor: Said Ghazali contributed reporting from Jerusalem; Nayef Hashlamoun from Hebron, West Bank; and Fares Akram from Gaza.

lead_paragraph: A group of Israelis was arrested in what one official described as a revenge killing. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu pledged to pursue the case and said, “We do not differentiate between terrorists.”

headline.main: 6 Israelis Held Over the Killing of Palestinian
headline.print_headline: 6 Israelis Held Over the Killing of a Palestinian
